alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 2:34PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...An area of heavier snow showers with a few embedded squalls will impact portions of southwestern Franklin, southeastern St. Lawrence and western Essex Counties through 315 PM EST... At 230 PM EST, scattered to numerous snow showers, some heavy were located across the southern third of St. Lawrence County, moving east at 35 mph. This activity will affect areas around Star Lake and Wanakena east to Tupper Lake along Route 3. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, and visibility as low as one quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Tupper Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Oswegatchie, Fowler, Newcomb, Piercefield, Wawbeek, Degrasse, Horseshoe Lake, Cranberry Lake, Star Lake, Harrietstown, Fine, Pitcairn, Edwards, Paul Smiths, Conifer, Saranac Inn and Talcville.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Essex
